page.title: 01Dunford Moors
page.content: This block is dominated by eroded, boggy, cotton grass moorland, with heather, bilberry, and mat grass on the dryer slopes. This presents very poor grazing, but rights are held by farms at Windleden (to the South) and Hazelhead Hall ( to the East) of this block. Separate shooting rights (red grouse) are held, and a gamekeeper employed at Harden Lodge to protect them. Although three quarters of this block fall within the Peak National Park, there is no public access, a bone of contention between ramblers and the land and lease holders, with the gamekeeper caught in the middle. Isolated dwellings exist at Harden, Snittlegate, and Long Ing; and even the main settlement at Dunford Bridge has only a few houses. Pic-nic sites have been created by the recently constructed Winscar reservoir.
